string-array.name: breed_3_key_characteristics
string-array.item: High sucrose accumulation during peak maturity
Strong ratoon performance for multiple cycles
Good resistance to borers and red rot
Performs well under both irrigated and rainfed conditions

string-array.name: breed_3_growing_tips
string-array.item: Plant in February–March for best tillering
Irrigate at critical stages: tillering, elongation & grand growth

string-array.name: breed_4_key_characteristics
string-array.item: Very high sugar recovery (suitable for early crushing)
Highly resistant to smut & red rot

string-array.name: breed_4_growing_tips
string-array.item: Prefer February planting for maximum sucrose yield
Light irrigation during early months; avoid waterlogging
Harvest at 10–11 months for peak sugar recovery

string-array.name: breed_5_key_characteristics
string-array.item: Strong cane formation with average sucrose

string-array.name: breed_5_growing_tips
string-array.item: Maintain proper seed treatment before planting
Avoid late harvesting to prevent sucrose decline

string-array.name: breed_6_key_characteristics
string-array.item: Good cane girth and stable growth
Suitable for both manual and mechanical harvesting

string-array.name: breed_6_growing_tips
string-array.item: Maintain row spacing 90–120 cm for optimum growth
Provide irrigation every 20–25 days during summer

string-array.name: breed_7_key_characteristics
string-array.item: High tolerance to excess moisture & temporary flooding

string-array.name: breed_7_growing_tips
string-array.item: Perfect for fields with poor drainage—avoid upland areas
Provide frequent irrigation in non-flooded periods
Harvest at 12–13 months for best juice quality

string-array.name: breed_8_key_characteristics
string-array.item: Early maturing with high sucrose content
Strong ratooning with high stalk count
Good resistance to red rot & smut

string-array.name: breed_8_growing_tips
string-array.item: Minimal water requirement — irrigate only when necessary
Harvest early to avoid sucrose loss
